label: Colors
name: colors
inline_help_text: ♿ Use Contrast Finder to check and optimize color contrasts for accessibility.

children.label: Brand Colors
children.help_text: The colors you define here will serve as base and be derived by further color settings.
children.inline_help_text: ⚠️ IMPORTANT: To work properly, both light scheme colors should be light and both dark scheme colors should be dark (read documentation).
children.name: brand_colors

children.label: Primary color
children.name: primary_color
children.inline_help_text: Set the default for accents, highlights, hover effects, buttons, etc.

children.label: Base Color Light
children.name: base_color_light
children.inline_help_text: Set the default background for light scheme and the light text color used for dark scheme.

children.label: Accent Color Light
children.name: accent_color_light
children.inline_help_text: Used to layer color within light scheme (e.g. box background color) and should be light.

children.label: Base Color Dark
children.name: base_color_dark
children.inline_help_text: Set the default background for dark scheme and the dark text color used for light scheme.

children.label: Accent Color Dark
children.name: accent_color_dark
children.inline_help_text: Used to layer color within dark scheme (e.g. box background color) and should be dark.

children.label: POWER
children.name: power
children.help_text: Color styles for POWER templates and modules

children.label: Title Color
children.name: title_color
children.inline_help_text: Section module titles, Hero Titles, Author Page Post Title, Blog Overview (1 Column Layout)

children.label: Link
children.name: link
children.inline_help_text: Applied to links in rich-text fields

children.label: Social Icon Color
children.name: social_icon_color
children.inline_help_text: Header Top (light), Author Page, Media Content Split module

children.label: Title Color
children.name: title_color
children.inline_help_text: Section module titles, Hero Titles, Author Page Post Title, Blog Overview (1 Column Layout)

children.label: Link
children.name: link
children.inline_help_text: Applied to links in rich-text fields

children.label: Boxed Elements
children.name: boxed_elements
children.help_text: All rectangular shaped content elements. E.g. Image Boxes or Accordions.

children.label: CTAs
children.name: ctas
children.help_text: POWER comes with different CTA styles for dark and light scheme. Those styles feed off of the following colors
children.inline_help_text:
Easiest to configure with the "Setup Guide" template, used for Buttons and CTAs throughout the theme.

⚠️ IMPORTANT: The CTA Button Style should be configured as Link (No Style) in the CTA settings (read documentation).

children.label: HubSpot Default
children.name: hs
children.help_text: Basic color styles independent of POWER modules

children.label: Basic Setup
children.name: fonts
children.help_text: Setup base font family, accent font family and font-smoothing

children.name: is_active
children.label: Activated?
children.help_text: Uncheck ONLY if you have configured a Custom Font (read documentation)

children.label: Font Weights
children.name: font_weights
children.help_text: Please do not activate italic fonts, if the selected Google font does not offer italic weigths! You can check that here: https://fonts.google.com/
children.inline_help_text: ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Only font weights available for the font family in the Google Fonts library can be checked (read documentation). Don't check more font weights than you need, this will impact page performance (read documentation).

children.name: is_active
children.label: Activated?
children.help_text: Uncheck ONLY if you have configured a Custom Font (read documentation)

children.label: Font Weights
children.name: font_weights
children.help_text: Please do not activate italic fonts, if the selected Google font does not offer italic weigths! You can check that here: https://fonts.google.com/
children.inline_help_text: We recommend to only activate font-weights that are used throughout your site and available for your selected font-family. This keeps the file-size of your font-files low and is healthy for your page loading time ;)

children.label: Use Font Smoothing
children.name: is_font_smoothing
children.inline_help_text: Controls the application of anti-aliasing when fonts are rendered

children.label: Formatting
children.name: font_settings
children.help_text: Setup font sizes, font weights, line heights, letter spacing for different elements

children.inline_help_text: Element between item marker and item content

children.label: Item Spacing
children.name: item_spacing
children.help_text: Vertical spacing between list items.

children.label: Style 01
children.name: style_01
children.inline_help_text:
Apply to text using HTML tag "mark"

Requires use of code tags (read documentation).

children.label: Font Family
children.name: font_family
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured font family of the text element.

children.label: Font Weight
children.name: font_weight
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured font weight of the text element.

children.label: Text Case
children.name: text_case
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured case of the parent text element.

children.label: Text Style
children.name: text_style
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured style of the text element.

children.label: Text Color
children.name: txt_color_light
children.help_text: Text Color of Highlight Text for Light Color Scheme

children.label: Text Color
children.name: txt_color_dark
children.help_text: Text Color of Highlight Text for Dark Color Scheme

children.label: Horizontal Padding
children.name: padding_hor
children.help_text: The unit em is a dynamic unit that takes the font-size into account. 1em = same as font size of text. 0.5em = half the font-size of the text, etc.

children.label: Underline/Mark Color
children.name: underline_mark_color_light
children.help_text: Underline/Mark Color of Highlight Text for Light Color Scheme

children.label: Underline/Mark Color
children.name: underline_mark_color_dark
children.help_text: Underline/Mark Color of Highlight Text for Dark Color Scheme

children.inline_help_text:
Apply to text using HTML tag "em"

Requires use of code tags (read documentation).

children.name: font_family
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured font family of the text element.

children.label: Font Weight
children.name: font_weight
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured font weight of the text element.

children.label: Text Case
children.name: text_case
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured case of the parent text element.

children.label: Text Style
children.name: text_style
children.help_text: Inherit uses the pre-configured style of the text element.

children.label: Text Color

children.help_text: Text Color of Highlight Text for Light Color Scheme

children.label: Text Color
children.name: txt_color_dark
children.help_text: Text Color of Highlight Text for Dark Color Scheme

children.name: padding_hor
children.help_text: The unit em is a dynamic unit that takes the font-size into account. 1em = same as font size of text. 0.5em = half the font-size of the text, etc.

children.label: Underline/Mark Style
children.name: highlight_mark_style
children.help_text: Can't be used when the title style is color or gradient.

children.help_text: Underline/Mark Color of Highlight Text for Light Color Scheme

children.label: Languages
children.name: languages
children.help_text: Choose the programming languages for which you want syntax highlighting.

children.label: Line Numbers
children.name: line_numbers
children.help_text: Displays line numbers on the left-hand side of the code.

children.label: Copy Code
children.name: copy_code
children.help_text: This options adds a small copy button on the top right corner of the code-block.

children.label: 3D Box Effect
children.name: is_3d_effect
children.inline_help_text: 3D effect when user hovers over a box element

children.label: Zoom Effect
children.name: is_zoom_effect
children.inline_help_text: Zoom effect when user hovers over a blog post

children.label: Button Hover Effect - Slide Up
children.name: is_btn_effect
children.inline_help_text: Background hover color slides up when user hovers over the element

children.label: Truncate Summary
children.name: truncate
children.help_text: Optionally cut summary text after a certain number of characters to be specified in "Truncate at"  Default for 2 and 3 column layout = 90 Default for one column = 240

children.label: 3D Box Effect
children.name: is_3d_effect
children.inline_help_text: 3D effect when user hovers over a blog post element

children.label: Zoom Effect
children.name: is_zoom_effect
children.inline_help_text: Zoom effect when user hovers over a blog post element

children.label: Blog Post Content Width
children.name: blog_post_content_width
children.help_text: Default - The default blog post content width in the POWER Theme is set to 795px. Website Content Width - Refers to the layout content width selected in the main theme settings, affecting all web pages. Custom - Allows you to specify a custom value (in pixels, with the default suffix 'px').

children.label: Section Paddings
children.name: spacing
children.inline_help_text: Related to section module layout settings: [padding-top, padding-bottom] (read documentation).

children.label: Section Margins
children.name: spacing_m
children.inline_help_text: Related to section module layout settings: [margin-top, margin-bottom].

children.label: Responsive Image Variants
children.name: images
children.inline_help_text: Images will be lazy-loaded and dynamically exchanged depending on device width and pixel density

children.label: Image width S
children.name: image_width_s
children.inline_help_text: Max. image width for [Mobile Landscape] or [Tablet Portrait]

children.label: Image width L
children.name: image_width_l
children.inline_help_text: Max. image width for [larger Tablets] or [small Desktops]

children.label: Retina image scaling
children.name: image_retina_scaling_factor
children.inline_help_text: Images will be scaled by this factor for higher density screens
children.help_text:
1 = no retina support (best performance)
1.5 = semi-retina support
2 = retina support (best quality)

children.label: Pause Video – Video Focus (deprecated)
children.name: pause_video_not_visible
children.help_text: Dependent on jQuery and deprecated with V26. Pauses the video, when it is not visible.

children.label: Pause Video – Window Focus (deprecated)
children.name: pause_window_not_focus
children.help_text: Dependent on jQuery and deprecated with V26. Pauses the video, when the window loose focus (switch tab, switch browser window).

children.label: Disable Video on Mobile
children.name: disable_mobile
children.help_text: Disables the video on mobile devices. The background image will be shown as a placeholder if configured.

children.label: Turn off Parallax on Mobile
children.name: switch_off_mobile_parallax
children.inline_help_text: This will remove the parallax scrolling effect from your section backgrounds on mobile

children.label: Enable jQuery
children.name: is_supported
children.inline_help_text: New users after DEC-08-22 should uncheck this setting. CRITICAL: For websites built prior to the release of v26 it is imperative to read the documentation and follow the course of action outlined to avoid causing your website to break or not display properly.

children.label: Enable jQuery Debug Tools
children.name: is_debug_tools_enabled
children.inline_help_text: Built-in tool to identify jQuery use within modules, access using HubSpot Developer Debug Mode.

children.label: Enable legacy structure
children.name: use_legacy_structure
children.inline_help_text: New users after MAR-22-23 should uncheck this setting. CRITICAL: For websites built prior to the release of v28 it is imperative to read the documentation and follow the course of action outlined to avoid causing your website to break or not display properly.

children.label: Schema.org
children.help_text:
⚠️ Important: HubSpot has introduced a built-in structured data (schema) option for blog posts.
You can find it under HubSpot Settings -> Blog -> General.
Our theme already includes a custom schema solution.
To avoid duplicate or conflicting schema markup, we recommend keeping HubSpot's blog schema setting disabled.
children.name: schema

children.label: Basic Schema
children.name: is_schema_basic
children.help_text: Company name, logo, address, language from Settings > Account Defaults > Branding as well as Email and Phone configured in the POWER header

children.label: Blog Post Schema
children.name: is_schema_blog_post
children.inline_help_text: Adds additional schema to blog posts
children.help_text: Headline, image, author, publish date, abstract, text, url, publisher, wordcount, tags

children.label: General
children.name: general
children.inline_help_text: Global animation settings like hover, slide, fade, etc. that are not related to Animation on Scroll.

children.label: Animation on Scroll?
children.name: is_aos
children.inline_help_text: Turn on/off animation on scroll globally (read documentation).

children.label: Default Offset
children.name: offset
children.inline_help_text: Offset (in px) from the original trigger point

children.label: Back to Top Button?
children.name: is_back_to_top
children.inline_help_text: Turn on/off the back to top button globally

children.label: Spacing
children.name: spacing
children.help_text: Space between back to top button and window borders

children.label: Spacing (Mobile)
children.name: spacing_mobile
children.help_text: Space between back to top button and window borders for mobile screens.

children.label: Shape
children.name: shape
children.help_text: Shape of the box surrounding the arrow

children.label: Size
children.name: sizes
children.help_text: Size of the box surrounding the arrow

children.label: Rule Sets
children.name: rule_sets
children.help_text: Select the rule sets you want to test against. See Axe Rule-Descriptions for more information.
choices: W3C approved Accessibility Conformance Testing rules

children.label: Enable ARIA Label Visualizer
children.name: enable_s10r_test
children.inline_help_text: Turn on/off ARIA Label Visualizer/Screen Reader Test Mode to view ARIA labels on elements.

children.label: Outline Color
children.name: outline_color
children.help_text: Color of the focus outline

children.name: enable_global_module_config
children.label: Enable Global Module Config by Default
children.help_text: This is advanced functionality for services maka Agency or it's partner agencies offer. Contact us for customization, migration, or setup requests.
